CatDescriptText: Mr. Don Poppelreiter, Carnegie, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "The ones I've seen seem to improve the communities.  I think that it should be encouraged.  I'm one of those funny guys who believe in only one God.  You should not condemn on segment of the segment of the population."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Don Poppelreiter, wearing textured button down coat with collar, pockets, and tabs on cuffs, and eyeglasses, standing with hands in pockets on Liberty Avenue in front of Empire Building, with pedestrians, buildings, and Jenkins Arcade entrance in background, Downtown
